intro: Dysphania anthelmintica, commonly known as giant false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Dysphania anthelmintica is also notable for its potential medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal practices.
